_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.

Five factors of a mendicant [an10.11:3.1: Faith in the Realized One’s awakening
Live with energy roused up for giving up unskillful qualities and embracing skillful qualities
Five factors of a lodging [an10.11:3.11]: Not bothered by people by day, and at night it’s quiet and still
Little disturbance from flies, mosquitoes, wind, sun, and reptiles
The necessities of life are easy to come by
Several senior mendicants who are very learned, knowledgeable in the scriptures, who have memorized the teachings, the monastic law, and the outlines
The wisdom of arising and passing away [: Leads to the complete ending of suffering
